#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Family
#Text=Coalition Party candidate Suzanne Fortin , Nepean-Carleton
#Text=Wednesday , September 26 , 2007
#Text=Suzanne Fortin is running for the Family Coalition Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Nepean-Carleton riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed her regarding her values , her experience , and her campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I decided to run because I like to tackle problems when I see them , and not sit on the sidelines .
#Text=I like to take the initiative to contribute to my community .
#Text=Nepean-Carleton needs a candidate to represent fiscal and social conservatism and I wanted to give voters the chance to express their support for those views .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I was involved in the federal NDP youth caucus when I was in college , as well as the provincial Liberals in Quebec ( I lived in Quebec City at the time ) .
#Text=I also volunteered for the Conservative Party in the last federal election .
#Text=I think my background in customer service is an asset .
#Text=When I was in the paid labour force ( I am now a stay-at-home mom ) I was a very conscientious employee , always trying to give good service and finding ways to do my job better .
#Text=I had a lot of initiative and good problem-solving skills .
#Text=I ’m not the kind of person who just does a job for the sake of a paycheque .
#Text=I find that boring .
#Text=I think that this attitude will make me attentive to my constituents ’ concerns .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=I believe that the Progressive Conservative party is the biggest challenger because they do attract social conservatives who want to fend off the election of a Liberal government .
#Text=The social conservative voters cling to the hope that if the PC ’s do n’t actually implement social conservative policies , they ’ll at least forestall a further slide into social breakdown .
#Text=It ’s a natural reaction in our First-Past-the-Post System , where voters tend to vote according to the perceived leader and not according to what they really want .
#Text=Unfortunately , the PC ’s just about never deliver on social conservatism , and their fiscal conservatism is n’t very strong this time around .
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
